TEXT: CARDINAL . The applicant was born in DATE and lives in GPE .

CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant was arrested . The applicant , Mr NORP , and PERSON were charged with CARDINAL count of robbery . The applicant was also charged with handling of CARDINAL handguns with cartridges .
CARDINAL . On DATE the proceedings against Mr B. were disjoined .
CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant was released having given a written undertaking not to abscond .
CARDINAL . In the period prior to DATE the NORP ORG of Kyiv ( the district court ) remitted the case twice for additional pre - trial investigation .
CARDINAL . On DATE the district court found the applicant guilty and sentenced him to CARDINAL years’ imprisonment . The applicant was arrested .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG ( the court of appeal ) quashed the part of the judgment concerning the applicant ’s conviction and remitted the case for fresh consideration to the district court . The court of appeal upheld the applicant ’s detention on remand .
CARDINAL . On DATE the district court remitted the case for additional pre - trial investigation . The applicant was remanded in custody .
CARDINAL . On DATE the court of appeal quashed the ruling of DATE and remitted the case to the district court for consideration . By the same decision it upheld the applicant ’s detention on remand .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG dismissed the applicant ’s appeal in cassation against the ruling of DATE .
CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant was released having given a written undertaking not to abscond .
CARDINAL . On DATE the district court sentenced the applicant to DATE and CARDINAL days’ imprisonment .
CARDINAL . On DATE and CARDINAL DATE the court of appeal and ORG , respectively , upheld the judgment of DATE .

CARDINAL . According to the records provided by the ORG , the applicant challenged a judge sitting in his case on CARDINAL occasions , and once he challenged a prosecutor . On CARDINAL occasions the applicant failed to appear .
